question: What is this feedback and welfare platform for?
answer: The platform is designed to collect, manage, and respond to student feedback and welfare concerns. It allows students to submit issues, track responses, and book wellness services in a secure and organized way.

question: Who can use this system at Africa University?
answer: All registered students at Africa University, including undergraduate and postgraduate students, can access and use the platform.

question: How do I register or log in as a student?
answer: Click 'Sign Up' to create an account using your student ID and email. You can also log in using your Africa University email or Google account.

question: Can I access the system on my mobile phone or tablet?
answer: Yes. The platform is responsive and works on phones, tablets, and desktops. For best results, use Chrome or Firefox.

question: What devices and browsers are supported?
answer: You can use laptops, tablets, or smartphones. Recommended browsers include Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, and Microsoft Edge.

question: Is this an official university system?
answer: Yes. It is officially supported by the Social Welfare Office in collaboration with the Computer Science Department and Student Union.

question: How is this system different from a physical suggestion box?
answer: Unlike a traditional box, this system offers digital tracking, admin response features, anonymous submissions, and booking services.

question: Is the system available 24/7?
answer: Yes. You can access and use the system at any time. Responses may be delayed outside normal office hours.

question: Can I use the system if I'm on a different campus?
answer: Yes. The platform is fully online and accessible from any device with internet access, regardless of your location.

question: What languages does the platform support?
answer: The platform currently supports English. Future updates may include local language options depending on student demand.

question: How do I reset my password if I forget it?
answer: Click the 'Forgot Password' link on the login page, enter your registered email, and follow the instructions to reset your password securely.

question: Can I log in using my university credentials or Google account?
answer: Yes. You can log in using your official Africa University email credentials or the 'Sign in with Google' option on the login screen.

question: What security measures protect my account?
answer: All accounts use encrypted authentication via JWT (JSON Web Tokens), and sensitive data is stored securely in compliance with institutional standards.

question: Does the system support two-factor authentication?
answer: Currently, the platform supports password-based login. Two-factor authentication is planned for future security upgrades.

question: How do I change my email or display name?
answer: Go to your profile settings, click 'Edit Profile', and update your email or display name, then save the changes.

question: Can I delete or deactivate my account permanently?
answer: Yes. You can request account deactivation by contacting the system administrator or welfare office directly through the support section.

question: What happens to my data if I graduate or leave the university?
answer: Your account is archived, but your feedback history remains stored in accordance with university data retention policies.

question: How do I know if someone else accessed my account?
answer: Unusual login attempts will be flagged. You can also view your login history in the account security section.

question: Are login attempts tracked or logged?
answer: Yes. The system keeps logs of login attempts for monitoring security breaches and auditing.

question: Will I receive alerts about suspicious account activity?
answer: Yes. If any suspicious activity is detected, you'll receive an alert email with instructions on securing your account.

question: How do I submit feedback through the platform?
answer: Click the 'Submit Feedback' tab on the homepage, select a feedback category, write your message, and click submit.

question: What kinds of feedback can I submit (academic, welfare, hostel, etc.)?
answer: You can submit feedback related to academic issues, welfare concerns, hostel conditions, food services, mental health, safety, and more.

question: Can I choose to submit feedback anonymously?
answer: Yes. When submitting feedback, select the 'Submit Anonymously' checkbox if you prefer to keep your identity private.

question: Is there a character limit on feedback entries?
answer: Yes. Each feedback entry allows up to 1000 characters. Use clear, concise language to explain your concern or suggestion.

question: Can I attach files, images, or videos with my feedback?
answer: Yes. You can upload supporting documents or images while submitting your feedback. Accepted formats include JPG, PNG, and PDF.

question: Can I rate the urgency of my submission?
answer: Yes. When submitting feedback, you can select an urgency level—Low, Medium, or High—to help prioritize your request.

question: How do I know my feedback was received?
answer: Once submitted, a confirmation message will appear, and your feedback will be visible under the 'Feedback Tracker' tab.

question: Can I follow up on or edit my feedback later?
answer: Yes. Go to the 'Feedback Tracker', find your submission, and click 'Edit' if the status is still pending.

question: How long does it take to get a response?
answer: Responses usually take 24 to 72 hours depending on the nature of the issue and the availability of support staff.

question: What happens after feedback is submitted?
answer: Your feedback is reviewed by authorized personnel. It may be routed to relevant departments for resolution and you will receive updates.

question: Can I track the status of my feedback?
answer: Yes. Go to the 'Feedback Tracker' tab to see all your submissions along with their current status such as Pending, In Review, or Resolved.

question: Who reads my feedback after submission?
answer: Feedback is reviewed by designated staff members from the Social Welfare Office or other relevant university departments.

question: Are feedback responses shared publicly or privately?
answer: Responses are shared privately through your dashboard, unless you choose to make your post public during submission.

question: Will I get updates when my issue is being resolved?
answer: Yes. You will receive email or platform notifications when there's a change in your feedback status.

question: How is feedback categorized and prioritized?
answer: Feedback is categorized by topic (e.g., academic, welfare, hostel) and urgency level set by the user or moderator.

question: Is feedback ever escalated to urgent response teams?
answer: Yes. If marked urgent or deemed critical by the system or moderators, your case is escalated to the appropriate response team.

question: Can I request to escalate my case if it is delayed?
answer: Yes. You can click 'Escalate' from the Feedback Tracker if your issue hasn't been addressed in the expected timeframe.

question: Will I be informed if my case is closed or forwarded?
answer: Yes. You will receive a final notification if your case is resolved, closed, or reassigned to another department.

question: Are anonymous cases handled the same as identified ones?
answer: Yes. All feedback is taken seriously, but follow-up may be limited for anonymous submissions.

question: Can I request a summary of all feedback I've submitted?
answer: Yes. You can download your feedback history from the 'Feedback Tracker' section in your user dashboard.

question: How do I book a wellness or counseling session on the platform?
answer: Click on the 'Book Appointment' tab, select the service type, fill in the details, and submit. You'll receive a confirmation email or notification once it's reviewed.

question: What wellness services are available to students?
answer: You can book Mental Health Counseling, Academic Support, Career Guidance, Medical Check-ups, and Peer Support sessions.

question: How can I view or manage my booked appointments?
answer: Go to the 'My Bookings' tab to see all your scheduled appointments. You can cancel or track the status from this page.

question: Will I receive email or SMS confirmation after booking?
answer: Yes. A confirmation is sent to your registered email and phone number once the booking is approved.

question: Can I reschedule or cancel my counseling session?
answer: Yes. Use the 'My Bookings' page to cancel, then submit a new booking to reschedule.

question: What should I do if I miss a session?
answer: Inform the wellness office via email or rebook your session. Missed sessions may require re-approval.

question: Are my wellness sessions confidential?
answer: Yes. All wellness sessions are confidential and only accessible to licensed and authorized wellness personnel.

question: Can I choose my preferred counselor or provider?
answer: Yes. While booking, select from the available staff list if visible. If not, the system assigns based on availability.

question: Is there a limit on the number of sessions per term?
answer: Yes. Students are allowed up to 3 non-urgent sessions per term, with flexibility for urgent needs.

question: Can I book a session for disability-related support?
answer: Yes. Choose the 'Disability Support' service during booking or note it in the description.

question: What if I need urgent mental health assistance?
answer: Use the 'Emergency Support' button for immediate contact or visit the Wellness Office during working hours.

question: Can I book offline and still get support through the system?
answer: Yes. You can visit the Social Welfare Office to book manually and your booking will be entered into the system by staff.

question: How do I use the chatbot on this platform?
answer: Click on the chat icon at the bottom corner of the page to launch the chatbot. Type your question to begin.

question: What types of questions can I ask the chatbot?
answer: You can ask about bookings, feedback submission, system navigation, mental health services, and general university support.

question: Is the chatbot trained to answer welfare-specific queries?
answer: Yes. The chatbot is designed to prioritize questions related to student welfare and directs users to appropriate resources.

question: Can the chatbot help me submit feedback or book services?
answer: Yes. The chatbot can walk you through submitting feedback or booking a session step-by-step.

question: Is my chat history private and secure?
answer: Yes. All interactions are encrypted and only used for improving service accuracy within university data protection policies.

question: What if the chatbot doesn't answer my question correctly?
answer: If the response is not helpful, type 'human support' or click the help option to escalate to a real support agent.

question: Will I be connected to a human if the bot can't help?
answer: Yes. The chatbot will refer your case to the Social Welfare Office or support team for a follow-up.

question: Is the chatbot available at all hours?
answer: Yes. The chatbot is available 24/7, but live support is only available during official working hours.

question: Can I disable the chatbot or mute its popups?
answer: Yes. You can mute or minimize the chatbot anytime using the gear icon in the chat window.

question: How do I report issues with the chatbot's performance?
answer: Click 'Feedback' in the chat window or email support@africau.edu to report problems with chatbot responses.

question: Can the chatbot provide updates on feedback or bookings?
answer: Yes. Ask the chatbot for 'my feedback status' or 'check my bookings' and it will retrieve updates for you.
